body.p:
Georgetown Ky
July 12th 1861
Gov Magoffin-
Respected sir-

Being as member of the state Guard in the company of the Union Greys at Georgetown Ky- and it having become almost impossible for me to discharge the duties devolved upon me as such- on account of lameness- I hereby msot respectfully tender my resignation in the same. In withdrawing, I propose to furnish a substitute and supply him with the uniform of the state Guard. Hoping that my resignation may be accepted

I remain your most obt servant
Jno Peak.
I hereby recommend the granting of the within discharge to private John L Peak

Sam W Long Capt
Commdg Union Greys

accepted
B Magoffin
Commander in Chief
